Executive Function.description: Higher-level cognitive processes that enable goal-directed behavior

Working Memory.description: The ability to hold information in mind and manipulate it

Inhibition.description: The ability to suppress inappropriate thoughts, actions, or emotions

Cognitive Flexibility.description: The ability to switch between different tasks or perspectives

Attention.description: The ability to focus on relevant information and ignore distractions

Information Maintenance.description: The processes involved in storing and accessing information in working memory

Response Inhibition.description: The ability to refrain from acting on impulses

Interference Control.description: The ability to resist distractions and focus on the task at hand

Mental Set Shifting.description: The ability to adjust to changing demands and perspectives

Task Switching.description: The ability to smoothly transition between different tasks

Selective Attention.description: Focusing on specific stimuli while ignoring others

Sustained Attention.description: Maintaining focus over a period of time

Encoding.description: The process of transforming information into a format suitable for storage

Retrieval.description: The process of accessing stored information

Impulse Control.description: The ability to regulate impulses and resist immediate gratification

Delay of Gratification.description: The ability to postpone immediate rewards for larger future rewards

Distraction Resistance.description: The ability to ignore distractions and maintain focus

Cognitive Filtering.description: The ability to select relevant information and filter out irrelevant information

Adaptability.description: The ability to adjust to changing circumstances

Problem Solving.description: The ability to find solutions to problems

Multitasking.description: The ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously

Efficient Processing.description: The ability to process information quickly and accurately
